Tannin Characteristics: Robust, structured, and soft tannins that support aging and provide a smooth mouthfeel.
Body Characteristics: Full-bodied with dark fruit, chocolate, spice, and tobacco notes.
Finish: <bold>Long</bold> and lingering, with rich flavors and smooth tannins.
Aroma: Ripe red fruits, spices, chocolate notes
Summary: Tenuta Sant'Antonio Amarone is a <bold>full-bodied</bold> red wine from the <bold>Veneto</bold> region of Italy, made from a blend of <bold>Corvina</bold>, <bold>Rondinella</bold>, <bold>Croatina</bold>, and <bold>Oseleta</bold> grapes. It features <bold>robust tannins</bold>, <bold>rich flavors</bold> of <bold>dark fruit</bold> and <bold>chocolate</bold>, and a <bold>long, smooth finish</bold>. The wine undergoes <bold>appassimento</bold> (grape drying) before fermentation and is aged for a <bold>minimum of 2 years</bold> in <bold>oak barrels</bold>.
